*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Cant[onment] Jessup La.*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="12-20-1830">December 20th. 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear sir.*/p*
*p*It has been a long time since I had the pleasure of your acquaintance, but I beg leave to bring to your recollection The time you passed*location_mentioned* Fort Riply*/location_mentioned*, on the *location_mentioned*Sabine */location_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1821">1821*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*bearer */person_mentioned*of this *person_mentioned*Mr. N. D Labadie*/person_mentioned* I beg leave to introduce to your acquaintance, as, a, young Gentleman, who visits your *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* with a view of locating himself somewhere, in your *location_mentioned*District of Country*/location_mentioned*, Either in the profession of medicine or in the Mercantile pursuits—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Labadie*/person_mentioned* has been in the Employ of *person_mentioned*Harrison and Hopkins */person_mentioned*for the last Eight Months and from what we have found, from That Experience, we have no hesitation in introducing him to you as a *person_mentioned*Gentleman */person_mentioned*worthy of the highest, respect, and one well qualified to discharge the duties of his profession—*/p*
*p*If you can render *person_mentioned*Mr. Labadie*/person_mentioned* any services in the way of his making an advantageous location—you will not only place him under particular obligations to you, but aliso your*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*D R Hopkins */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] To *person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F, Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*St. Phillipe de Austin Texas */location_mentioned* Pr *person_mentioned*Mr Labadie*/person_mentioned**/p*
